comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Women's Peace Party: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woman%27s_Peace_Party Emmeline Pethick-Lawrence(1867-1954), English feminist and peace activist: www.spartacus.schoolnet.co.uk/Wpethick.htm Jane Addams (1860-1935), first American woman to be awarded the Nobel Peace Prize: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jane_Addams Alice Thacher Post (1853-1947), editor, active with the Women's Peace Party, second wife of Louis Freeland Post (his papers are in the LOC): memory.loc.gov/ammem/awhhtml/awmss5/ed_pub.html

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Leaving New York aboard the Noordam in April, 1915.

comment.author: 34911459@N08
comment._content: Thanks for the full names and additional information.  We will update the record.

comment._content: A picture very similar to this is on page one of the New York Evening World, April 13, 1915. chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030193/1915-04-13/ed-...
